title: Now I need the type of the Sea Island.....
content:
Stuck on this one…….aaaggghhh! I may have to go back to massive caffeine intake again!!! MY brain does not function without it!!!  
Off the wall note, several years ago at MacWorld, I snagged a font ID guide from Adobe that listed most of their stuff, has there ever been an update to that? A pdf download or some such? It’s been mighty helpful for ID’ing fonts, but an accidental trashing of it has left me going nuts over fonts that I can no longer pick out…

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [SeaIslandBankLogocolor-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060504090235/http:/typophile.com/files/SeaIslandBankLogocolor-1.jpg) | 57.02 KB |
author: dunnyman

comments.content:
I think it could be [ITC Clearface Heavy](http://web.archive.org/web/20060504090235/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-clearface/heavy/testdrive.html?s=SEA+ISLAND&p=60), slightly mucked around with.  
The italic is more slanted than your sample, so it might be the Heavy, slightly shortened and obliqued.

Good quick catch, David. My post was just after yours.  
————————————————————-  
Yes, I’m old, but I’m slower than David!
